PositionHistory.Title: Graduate Student Researcher
PositionHistory.Description: Authored four conference papers on real-time Java and CORBA Led NSF-funded research project in middleware for wireless, peer-to-peer, self-organizing traffic management systems Project manager of Autonet, a research effort funded by the National Science Foundation to develop peer-to-peer, self-organizing traffic management systems Created ZenQA, automatic verification and performance analysis tool for middleware Contributing author of National Science Foundation grant proposal "Collaborative Research: Components and Aspects for Embedded Middleware". Approved for $690,000 from 2004 to 2007.

PositionHistory.Title: English Teacher
PositionHistory.Description: Instructed Japanese students in English as a second language Designed lesson plans and group activities Presented demo lessons to potential customers

PositionHistory.Title: Math and Physics Teacher
PositionHistory.Description: Co-authored "Peace Corps Math Manual", a collection of lesson plans Founded and led after-school clubs in African literature and computer literacy Launched "Girls Club" program to encourage girls to stay in school Conceived and supervised a community-based "Physics Day" to showcase students' abilities and encourage physics education Created stage adaptation of a scene from the Nigerian book Things Fall Apart to be performed by students Coached students in games of baseball, basketball, and (American) football Trained and evaluated new Peace Corps volunteers in teaching techniques

PositionHistory.Title: Software Engineer
PositionHistory.Description: Assisted with development of low-power, handheld computer Overhauled and documented graphics subsystem Implemented space-efficient database API Programmed serial port driver Built from scratch a space-efficient database library Programmed serial port driver to enable both wired and infrared connections Designed custom user interface, icons, and fonts Redesigned and redeployed engineering firm's web site for easier navigation and readability Developed Java-based desktop application for data synchronization with device.

PositionHistory.Title: Research Assistant
PositionHistory.Description: Completed undergraduate research of team-oriented databases Developed algorithms for visualizing DNA sequences Presented, with visual aids and live demonstrations, results of thesis research to associates Completed academic research of multi-tier database architectures using Java and SQL Developed algorithms for visualizing DNA sequences as XML; funded by U.S. Human Genome Project

PositionHistory.Title: Software Engineer
PositionHistory.Description: Wrote C++ libraries to speed development of large Oracle-based client/server database Designed APIs for application automation and network messaging Trained peers by designing and leading an 8-hour tutorial on ActiveX, the software component architecture Designed and implemented systems for application automation (via OLE and DCOM) and network messaging

PositionHistory.Title: Software Engineer
PositionHistory.Description: Ported low-level graphics API from Unix to Windows

PositionHistory.Title: Software Engineer
PositionHistory.Description: Designed, implemented, and tested pluggable user interface components for Microsoft Windows programmers using Visual C++ and Visual Basic

PositionHistory.Title: Data Entry Clerk
PositionHistory.Description: Data processing of accounts and customer records.

SchoolOrInstitution.Comments: Developed teaching skills in the California Community College Internship Program (CCCIP), where I partnered with faculty at a local college to gain real-world teaching experience and knowledge of the activities and responsibilities associated with an academic career.

Degree.Comments: Active member of Alpha Phi Omega
Honors program graduate. Phi Theta Kappa member.
Graduated with honors in top 2% of class.

Article.Title: CORBA is dead! Long live CORBA!
Article.Abstract: Though it's no longer trendy, CORBA is alive and well. This article shows developers how to take advantage of CORBA services on Linux.

Article.Title: Building a Universal SQL Client
Article.Abstract: The Qt toolkit's SQL classes can help build a database client that can run almost anywhere.

Article.Title: Portability and the ARM Processor
Article.Abstract: Porting a Linux application to the StrongARM-based iPAQ handheld computer showed that "ANSI C" and "portability" don't always go hand-in-hand.

Article.Title: Linux and the iPAQ, Arm in Arm
Article.Abstract: The Compaq iPAQ: Is it a consumer product or a powerful platform for embedded applications? This article shows how to create an embedded-style application for the iPAQ.

Article.Title: More than one way to make a difference
Probing the Palm OS
Article.Abstract: You can develop Palm applications in most any host language. Here's how to do so in C.

Article.Title: Girls in Ghana Get Computerized
Article.Abstract: Experiences teaching computer literacy to female students in Ghana, West Africa
Article.JournalOrSerialName: The Exchange: Peace Corps' Women in Development Newsletter

Article.Title: Zarte Bande knüpfen: Java Communications API
Article.Abstract: Describes how to communicate through the serial port in Java. (Written in German for publication in Germany.)

Article.Title: A class hierarchy for team-oriented database application development on the Java platform
Article.Abstract: Database application development is a complex task. In recent years, a move toward object-oriented design and the client/server paradigm has produced a cleaner, more formal structure for the task, and technologies such as the Java platform’s JDBC architecture have simplified the implementation process. These approaches, however, focus primarily on the raw data link between the client and the server. Relatively few technologies address the problem of how to extend this link to the graphical user interface. In this paper, I present a class hierarchy for extending the link to the Java platform’s user interface. The hierarchy binds data types on the server to a corresponding user interface class on the client. These classes may be extended, modified, and loaded dynamically at runtime to provide high flexibility and customization. Due to its reliance on standard design patterns and traditional data abstraction techniques, the hierarchy is ideal for team-oriented database application development, in which three independent teams work separately: one each for the database server, the client application framework, and the user interface widgets within the framework. Source code for the complete, ready- to-use classes is available. A discussion of future extensions to the hierarchy is also included.

Article.Title: Using RMI in the Real World
Article.Abstract: In theory, RMI makes it easy to connect Java running on different machines. In practice, there are still some obstacles for the unwary. Trevor offers seven useful tips.

Article.Title: Von Menschen und Fruchtfliegen: Mit RMI auf einfache Weise verteilte Java-Anwendungen erstellen
Article.Abstract: Describes Java's Remote Method Invocation (RMI) protocol and how to use it. (Written in German for publication in Germany.)

Article.Title: Java Dates Made Simple
Article.Abstract: Date handling has been yet another criticism of the Java API. With the need for strong international support, Sun wisely opted to license a set of date and time classes from Taligent that provide excellent support for custom languages and time zones, as well as comprehensive classes for handling dates and times.

Article.Title: Maskenball: ActiveX in Java einfügen, JavaBeans in ActiveX? Microsoft Java SDK 2.0
Article.Abstract: Using the Java SDK to integrate JavaBeans components with ActiveX controls. (Written in German for publication in Germany.)

Article.Title: Java SDK 2.0: A two-way bridge between ActiveX and Java
Article.Abstract: The new version of the Microsoft Java SDK packs power and simplicity, providing a nearly transparent two-way bridge between the ActiveX architecture and the Java language. You now have the freedom to choose whatever tool works best for you.

Article.Title: Informant Spotlight: Java Controls
Article.Abstract: Java is the be-all and end-all. At least, that's the hype. But programs must be rewritten in Java before they can claim its advantages, and who has time for that? Enter OLE Automation. This articles shows how to transform Java programs into OLE objects.

Article.Title: Sun's ActiveX Bridge
Article.Abstract: Sun's new structure spans the chasm between JavaBeans and ActiveX controls, allowing the former to act as the latter. Read how this new route may lead to better Web pages and allow you to work both sides of the divide.

Article.Title: OLE Controls for Mortals
Article.Abstract: The machinery behind OLE controls is complex, but it's object-oriented and can be inherited in toto from MFC. In the future, your OLE control will work without modification across distributed networks and the World Wide Web.

Article.Title: Tech Tips: An MFC class for DIB sections
Article.Abstract: Offers a custom Microsoft Foundation Classes class to provide simplified creation and manipulation of Device-Independent Bitmaps under Windows.

Article.Title: Extending the Win95 Taskbar Tray
Article.Abstract: That little thing in the corner of your screen could be an opportunity to make small apps big winners.

Article.Title: Exploring the science of love
Article.Abstract: Light-hearted commentary on the similarities between romantic love and physics.
Article.JournalOrSerialName: Student Life: Washington University's Student Newspaper

Article.Title: Tech Tips: A C++ class for microsecond timer services
Article.Abstract: A C++ class for microsecond timing, based on QueryPerformanceCounter().

Article.Title: Tech Tips: An easy digital video interface library
Article.Abstract: A function library to play and manipulate full-motion video under Windows.

Article.Title: Manipulating Bitmap Palettes in Windows
Article.Abstract: Device-independent bitmaps (DIBs) might more accurately be called "color-independent," since their only claim to device independence is that they contain a color table, or palette. This article explains the DIB format and shows how you can manipulate a DIB's palette at runtime to accomplish useful effects.

Article.Title: Extending the Windows File Manager
Article.Abstract: If you learn how to negotiate with the Windows file manager, it can make your code look like part of the establishment.

Book.Title: Web Developer's Guide To Visual J++ And ActiveX
Book.Abstract: Provides step-by-step guides for building Java applets and ActiveX controls. Features a tour of Visual J++, including the debugger, the Java Type Library Wizard, and the Applet Wizard. Includes tips for integrating the power of ActiveX with the elegance of Java. Contains instructions for writing database applications in Java, enhancing applets with OLE automation, and code-signing your ActiveX controls. Shows how to incorporate VBScript and JavaScript code with controls and applets. CD-ROM included. This book has been translated into Spanish and Korean.

Book.Title: Programming JavaBeans 1.1
Book.Abstract: Explains how to deploy Java applications on the Web and create Bean components with advanced functionality.

Book.Title: Visual J++ Bible
Book.Abstract: A reference and tutorial for Visual J++. Also shares basic principles of effective Web site, software, and user interface design. Includes CD-ROM.

OtherPublication.Abstract: A quick-start guide for installing TimeSys Linux on a typical desktop workstation.
